item.title: Matt Chandler - Is church membership biblical?
item.description: I’m not sure that membership is biblical. Matt Chandler wrote an article a while back. This article summarises my thoughts on the article and the topic in general. Matt felt the same way I do now and was persuaded that it is biblical. He outlines in this article what persuaded him. Main Article -“Is church membership biblical?” Comments “The spouse of Christ cannot be adulterous; she is uncorrupted and pure.

item.title: Reasons for Withrawing from the Churches of God
item.description: var refTagger = { settings: { bibleVersion: "ESV", tooltipStyle: "dark" } }; (function(d, t) { var g = d.createElement(t), s = d.getElementsByTagName(t)[0]; g.src = "//api.reftagger.com/v2/RefTagger.js"; s.parentNode.insertBefore(g, s); }(document, "script")); Distinctives Churches of God What They Got Right The distinction between the ‘Church the Body’, and the ‘Churches of God’. The Exclusive Brethren ‘One Body’ The RCC ‘Catholic Church’ conflate the 2 concepts into the one. I believe this to be in error.

item.title: metropolitan connexial governance
item.description: Exclusive Brethren dronsfield1993 The only way a division is possible amongst Open Brethren is for a group of meetings to forsake independency and separate from those who practise it…independents profess not to recognise groups or circles of meetings. (p. 6) Because of the great increase in the numbers of meetings, further light was being sought as to the Scriptural principles in the practical administration of the assembly. It was observed - firstly it is believed by G.

item.title: metropolitan connexial governance
item.description: Exclusive Brethren dronsfield1993 The only way a division is possible amongst Open Brethren is for a group of meetings to forsake independency and separate from those who practise it…independents profess not to recognise groups or circles of meetings. (p. 6) Because of the great increase in the numbers of meetings, further light was being sought as to the Scriptural principles in the practical administration of the assembly. It was observed - firstly it is believed by G.

Exodus 19:1-13; 20:1-17 19:1-13 What does this passage teach us about God? .(v10-11) It takes 2 days of concecretion for us to even see God. Even then, he will come conceiled in a thick cloud. .(v12) Touching where is presence was would lead to instant death. Even at Israel’s most consecrated state, they were not holy enough to touch the ground he stood in How should we relate to such a God?
